key_facts: The EU recorded an 8% drop in greenhouse gas emissions in 2023.
The emissions drop was due to reduced coal use and increased renewables.
Renewables became the EU’s leading electricity source in 2023.
EU emissions are now 37% below 1990 levels.
The EU is on track to meet its 2030 goal of a 55% emissions reduction.
The emissions decline occurred alongside a 68% GDP increase.
The EU showed a decoupling of economic growth and emissions.
Global greenhouse gas concentrations continued to rise in 2023.
The EU’s climate progress contrasts with global emissions trends.
Nuclear power was overtaken by renewables in the EU energy mix.
